track_info.note: User's remaster showing 'sub-bass power enhancement' pattern

characteristics.user_description: Fat, heavy guitar, tougher basslines, broader range in drums
characteristics.actual_implementation: Massive sub-bass boost, cut upper-mids, cut low-mids to make room
characteristics.key_insight: Fat/heavy = sub-bass foundation, NOT midrange boost
characteristics.genre_agnostic: This pattern applies to ANY music with weak sub-bass and harsh upper-mids
special_notes: NOT a genre template - it's a position shift in continuous frequency space
Same enhancement could apply to hip-hop, doom metal, dubstep, reggae
Detection based on SOURCE characteristics, not genre labels
Sub-bass boost (+13.8%) is the key differentiator
Upper-mid cut (-6.9%) reduces harshness, creates warmth
Low-mid cut (-6.7%) makes room for sub-bass, reduces muddiness

processing_recommendations.description: Significant transformation to add sub-bass power and reduce harshness
techniques: Low-mid cut (250-500 Hz): -7% to make room
Upper-mid cut (2-4 kHz): -7% to reduce harshness
Presence cut (4-8 kHz): -3% for less brittle sound
Slight compression: -1.5 dB crest for control

expected_result.sound_quality: Fat, heavy, powerful, warm, not harsh
expected_result.dynamics: Slightly more controlled but still punchy
expected_result.overall: Modern heavy sound without excessive compression

applies_to: ANY music with weak sub-bass + harsh upper-mids
does_not_apply_to: Balanced frequency music (Rush Presto) - use perceived loudness instead

framework_integration.note: This is NOT a genre template - it's a TARGET POSITION in 10D frequency space
